data.headline: S&P 500 closed nearly unchanged at -0.01%, Dow edged up 0.08%, while Nasdaq and Russell slipped on continued tech rotation.
bullets: Over $1.3 trillion in megacap tech value erased as volatility remains high in Microsoft, Amazon, Nvidia, Apple, and Alphabet.
Intel and Micron weighed on chip stocks, extending last week's AI-driven selloff despite some intraday rebounds.
JPMorgan and Bank of America led banks higher, each climbing around 1%.
ZIM Integrated Shipping surged on a $4.2 billion buyout offer, while Danaher and Masimo tumbled on earnings and commentary.
General Mills slid after trimming its 2026 guidance, and Constellation Energy drew attention on AI-driven power demand.
Munich Re announced 1,000 AI-linked job cuts, highlighting sector concerns.
Deal chatter increased around Paramount/Skydance, renewed Warner Bros. interest, Blackstone's pursuit of Champions Group, and Elliott's stake in Norwegian Cruise Line.
No major economic data released today, but traders are monitoring Fed balance-sheet debates and earlier dovish commentary.
Key events later this week include PCE inflation, Q4 GDP, Fed minutes, jobs data, and earnings from Nvidia, Walmart, Palo Alto Networks, DoorDash, Energy Transfer, and Vulcan Materials.
